question: Which one of the following geographical regions includes the island country "Fiji"?
explanation: Fiji is an island country located in the Melanesia subregion of the Oceania geographic region in the South Pacific Ocean, northeast of New Zealand. Melanesia extends from New Guinea Island in the southwestern Pacific Ocean to the Arafura Sea and eastward to Tonga, which includes four independent countries such as Fiji, Vanuatu, Solomon Islands, and Papua New Guinea.
